title: FINDOLOGIC Search API JSON response 1.0
description: JSON format for search results, filters, and more.

filterMetadata.description: Configured and computed data for individual filters.

value.description: The filter value, as selected or suitable for visualization.

min.description: The absolute possible minimum value of the filter given present query and other filters.

max.description: The absolute possible maximum value of the filter given present query and other filters.

selectedMin.description: In case of a selected filter, the minimum value of the selected range.

selectedMax.description: In case of a selected filter, the maximum value of the selected range.

weight.description: The numeric indicator of the impact the filter value has on the result. The higher, the more specific the results will be.

frequency.description: The number of products matching a filter. Not supported in all configuration constellations.

colorCode.description: For color filters, the hexadecimal code corresponding to the color. The filter's value is the configured color name in such a case.

selected.description: In available multi-select filters, this indicates filter values that have already been selected.

availableFilter.description: A selected value, with limited metadata as compared to available filters.

name.description: The internal name of the filter (as exported).

displayName.description: The configured display name of the filter.

selectMode.description: Whether one or more filter values can be selected at the same time. Only applies to a subset of available filter types.

noAvailableFiltersText.description: Optionally configurable text intended to be shown in case there are no more filter values available for selection.

pinnedFilterValueCount.description: This is the number of filter values that should always be shown, and any more values than that should be hidden, e.g. by putting them in a dropdown.

request.description: Selection of mirrored request parameters, including defaults for some that weren't specified, if applicable.

serviceId.description: Mirrored from the required request parameter "shopkey"

usergroup.description: In case usergroups are used and one is set in the query, the one that was used. Only relevant for services with XML export.

groups.description: In case groups are used and one or more are set in the query, the ones being used. Only relevant for services with CSV export.

userId.description: Anonymous ID of the searching user. Only set if provided.

field.description: Field to sort by if relevanceBased is false. Otherwise, numeric values from this field are used to influence the otherwise relevance-based score.

relevanceBased.description: Whether products are sorted by relevance based on query matches, or if sorting should happen strictly by a numeric value.

direction.description: Whether to sort products from lowest to highest or otherwise.

selectedFilters.description: Filters that have previously been selected.

result.description: Matching results, filters, and metadata about the result.

metadata.description: Request metadata, including information on certain merchandising features, if they apply to the query.

effectiveQuery.description: The query that was actually used to serve the results. Relevant for variants like Smart Did-You-Mean that may override the user query.

totalResults.description: The total number of matches, going beyond pagination limits.

requestId.description: Unique ID of the request that was processed for log correlation purposes.

searchConcept.description: In case the search triggers a Search Concept, this is its name.

landingpage.description: In case the search triggers a Landingpage, this is its name and URL.

name.description: Name of the matching Landingpage, intended for display and tracking.

url.description: URL of the Landingpage, which should be either redirected to, or offered to the user as a link.

promotion.description: In case the search triggers a promotion, this is its name and URL.

name.description: Name of the matching promotion, intended for display and tracking.

url.description: URL of the page the promotion image should link to.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image to use for displaying the promotion.

variant.description: Information on decisions a search logic variant made.

name.description: Name of the search logic variant in use.

correctedQuery.description: In case of Smart Did-You-Mean, the correction of the user query.

improvedQuery.description: In case of Smart Did-You-Mean, a query that was deemed more useful than the user query.

didYouMeanQuery.description: In case of Smart Did-You-Mean, a query related to the user query which one might also be interested in.

items.description: The matching items, constraint by the pagination parameters. The values being shown respect the specified usergroup, if applicable.

imageUrl.description: Primary image URL. Additionally exported images can be accessed via the item's properties.

name.description: Name of the item without any query-based highlighting.

highlightedName.description: Name of the item with portions of it highlighted if matching the query. The matching part is wrapped in a <span class="flEmphasis"> tag.

ordernumbers.description: The item's ordernumbers. Currently, only the first exported one is available.

properties.description: Non-searchable value exported as properties. Includes additional images, if applicable. The desired values have to be requested with the 'properties[]' parameter

productPlacement.description: In case a Product Placement matches the product, this is its name.

pushRules.description: In one or more Push Rules match a product, these are the names.

attributes.description: Attribute values that apply to an item, if the attribute was requested via outputAttrib.

availableFilters.description: Filters available based on the query, and as configured in the filter configuration. Does not include inactive filters.

other.description: Filters configured for secondary visibility. Should be initially hidden or collapsed.
